general:
General Help
See the `general-quick-start` help entry to use the bot.
See the `general-supported-websites` help entry to see info about supported websites.
See the `general-playlist-support` help entry for info on playlists.
[**Admin only**] See the `general-permissions` help entry for permission info and setup.
See `general-behaviour` help entry for info on bot behavior during playback or while idle in a voice channel.
See `general-common-questions` help entry for info on common issues and questions.
general-quick-start:
`Quick start`
Use the **/join** command to invite the bot to your VC and **/add** or **/playnow** to play a track!
To find help about a specific command, use the **/help** command with the command name as the entry.
A music role may be required if set up by guild administrators.
general-supported-websites:
`Supported websites`
- **YouTube** search queries or video/playlist* URLs.
- **Newgrounds** audio URLs.
- **SoundCloud** search queries, URLs and playlists* (sets)
- **Bandcamp** URLs or playlists*.
Refer to the **url-formats** help entry for URL formats.
_*Playlist support may depend on command._
general-playlist-support:
`Playlist support`
A maximum of **10** playlists is allowed **per guild** and each can contain **100** maximum tracks by default.
Playlists can be modified/accessed with commands that start with **playlist**.
A playlist role may be required if set up by guild administrators to use playlist commands.
general-permissions:
`Permissions`
For owners/users with **Administrator permissions**, a specified **role** can be set as the default to **allow execution** of music/playlist commands respectively only for **users that have said roles**.
These can be applied with the `/role-set` command.
By default, no roles are set, users are free to use both music and playlist commands. It is highly recommended to set up these in a large guild.
general-behaviour:
`Bot behaviour`
Here's a list of actions the bot may do on specified conditions:
- The bot disconnects from a voice channel if no users are left in it as soon as the last user leaves to prevent unused guild data from piling up.
- The bot welcomes any user that joins its current channel in the text channel the **/join** command was used in. (configurable per-session via commands)
- The bot may delete playlist and role configuration if removed from a guild.
- The bot modifies VC status every track playback. Setting it to '_Listening to [track name]_' (configurable per-session via commands).
- [**EXPERIMENTAL**] The bot may recover from a player crash by resuming approximately at time it crashed.
general-common-questions:
`Common questions`
Here's a list of common questions about help with features/bot quirks:
> How do I use command X?
Use /help **{command}** to see its help entry.
> [**Admin only**] What to do in case of unreadable role/playlist structure? ('_Failed to read..._' error)
Use the `/role-reset` or `/playlist-reset` command. This will wipe any saved configuration :(
> Why no **/volume** command?
To prevent disputes over volume (and save implementation costs), each user manages their own volume output from the bot using Discord's '_user volume_' slider.
> Bot doesn't play tracks from [website]
Some websites may block the bot from extracting tracks, therefore the bot is unable to play them. In such case, if it occurrs while extracting, the bot ignores it and returns an error. Instead, if it happens during playback, it will skip to the next one if available.
> Playback is slow / choppy!
The source website might not provide high quality audio streams or the bot is overloaded. Try with another website or wait a while.
url-formats:
`URL formats`
- **YouTube** URLs must follow the following format: **`https://youtube.com/watch?v=[ID]`** for videos or **`https://youtube.com/playlist?list=[ID]`** for playlists.
- **Newgrounds** URLs must follow the following format: **`https://newgrounds.com/audio/listen/[ID]`**
- **SoundCloud** URLs must follow the following format: **`https://soundcloud.com/[author]/[name]`** for songs or **`https://soundcloud.com/[author]/sets/[name]`** for playlists.
- **Bandcamp** URLs must follow the following format: **`https://[user].bandcamp.com/track/[name]`** for songs or **`https://[user].bandcamp.com/album/[name]`** for playlists.
NOTE: Anything not matching these formats but still looking like a URL will be invalidated.
join:
Help for command: **join**
`Quick usage`
/join
`Description`
Invites the bot to join your voice channel.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, User in a voice channel and Bot in none, Bot must also have channel permission to `connect` and `speak`.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
leave:
Help for command: **leave**
`Quick usage`
/leave
`Description`
Makes the bot leave your voice channel.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, no active extractions, queue modifications or locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
add:
Help for command: **add**
`Quick usage`
/add **<queries>** **<search_provider>**
`Description`
Adds **specified** track(s) (or playlist) to the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<queries>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of **YouTube** (video or playlist), **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** (song or playlist), **Bandcamp** (song or playlist) URLs _or_ **YouTube**/**SoundCloud search queries** depending on **<search_provider>** (Can be mixed). Refer to **url-formats** help entry for URL formats.
- **<search_provider>** [**EXPERIMENTAL**] The provider to use for search queries. URLs ignore this. (defaults to **YouTube search**)
`Examples`
- /add **queries:C418 Aria Math; C418 Sweden; https://soundcloud.com/tailspun/1f1n1ty-starstruck-by-day-by-night; Angelic Party\\; xi search_provider:YouTube search**
`Notes`
- Only up to **25** (default) queries can be sent per command.
- To search for queries that have semicolons in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
- Affects copied queue if /queueloop is enabled.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, no **active extractions** or **queue modifications**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playnow:
Help for command: **playnow**
`Quick usage`
/playnow **<query>** **<search_provider>** **<keep_current_track>**
`Description`
Plays the requested track **without** adding it to the queue. Stops any currently playing track.
`Parameters`
- **<query>** can be a **YouTube** (video **only**), **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** (song **only**) or **Bandcamp** URL (song **only**) _or_ **YouTube**/**SoundCloud** **search query** based on **<search_provider>**. Refer to **url-formats** help entry for URL formats.
- **<search_provider>** [**EXPERIMENTAL**] The provider to use for search queries. URLs ignore this. (defaults to **YouTube search**)
- **<keep_current_track>** Keeps the current track (if any) by re-inserting it at the start of the queue. (default True)
`Examples`
- /playnow **query:a_hisa - Dysthymia search_provider:SoundCloud search**
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, **no active extractions** and **no active queue modifications** (if **<keep_current_track>** is True).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
skip:
Help for command: **skip**
`Quick usage`
/skip **<amount>**
`Description`
Skips the **current** (or **multiple**) track(s) and plays the next one.
`Parameters`
- **<amount>** is the amount of tracks to skip. Starts from the current track.
`Examples`
- /skip **amount:2**
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, an **active track**, a queue with atleast **1** track and **<amount>** must be >= **1** and <= **25**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
nextinfo:
Help for command: **nextinfo**
`Quick usage`
/nextinfo
`Description`
Shows information about the **next** track in the **queue**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and a queue with atleast **1** track in it.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
previousinfo:
Help for command: **previousinfo**
`Quick usage`
/previousinfo
`Description`
Shows information about the **previous** track in the **track history**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, and a track history with >= **2** tracks.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
pause:
Help for command: **pause**
`Quick usage`
/pause
`Description`
**Pauses** the **current** track.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, an active track and playback **must not be paused** already.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
resume:
Help for command: **resume**
`Quick usage`
/resume
`Description`
**Resumes** the **current** track.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and playback **must be paused**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
stop:
Help for command: **stop**
`Quick usage`
/stop
`Description`
**Stops** the current track and **resets** the bot's state to its default (join state).
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, an **active/paused track**, **no active extractions**, no **locked voice state** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
restart:
Help for command: **restart**
`Quick usage`
/restart
`Description`
**Restarts** the **current** track.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and an **active track playback**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
select:
Help for command: **select**
`Quick usage`
/select **<track_name>** **<by_index>** **<keep_current_track>**
`Description`
Selects **first occurrence** of track matching **<track_name>** name (or index) from the queue and plays it. Selected track is **removed** from the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<track_name>** is the name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) of the track to select.
- **<by_index>** Selects track by its index. (default False)
- **<keep_current_track>** Keeps the current track (if any) by re-inserting it at the start of the queue. (default False)
`Examples`
- /select **track_name:otherside**
- /select **track_name:2** **by_index:True**
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, a queue with atleast **1** track and no **active queue modifications**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
select-random:
Help for command: **select-random**
`Quick usage`
/select-random **<keep_current_track>**
`Description`
Selects a **random track** from the queue and plays it. Selected track is **removed from the queue**.
`Parameters`
- **<keep_current_track>** Keeps the current track (if any) by re-inserting it at the start of the queue. (default False)
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, a queue with atleast **one** track and no **active queue modifications**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
replace:
Help for command: **replace**
`Quick usage`
/replace **<track_name>** **<new_track_query>** **<search_provider>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Replaces **first occurrence** of track matching **<track_name>** name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) by fetching **another one** from **YouTube**, **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** or **Bandcamp**.
`Parameters`
- **<track_name>** is the track to replace's name (or index, if **<by_index>** is True).
- **<new_track_query>** must be a **YouTube** (video **only**), **SoundCloud** (song **only**), **Newgrounds**, **Bandcamp** (song **only**) URL _or_ a **YouTube**/**SoundCloud search query** depending on **<search_provider>**. Refer to **url-formats** help entry for URL formats.
- **<search_provider>** [**EXPERIMENTAL**] The provider to use for search query. URLs ignore this. (defaults to **YouTube search**)
- **<by_index>** Replaces track by its index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /replace **track_name:Minecraft** **new_track_query:Sweden C418**
- /replace **track_name:5** **new_track_query:Sweden C418** **by_index:True**
- /replace **track_name:2** **new_track_query:a_hisa - Dysthymia** **search_provider:SoundCloud search** **by_index:True**
`Notes`
- Affects copied queue if **/queueloop** is enabled.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, chosen track **must be in queue** and no **active extractions** or **queue modifications**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
loop:
Help for command: **loop**
`Quick usage`
/loop **<track_name>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Submits a request to loop the **current** or **specified** track. Functions as a **toggle** and has **priority** over **/random** or **/queueloop**.
`Parameters`
- **<track_name>** The track to loop's name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True). (defaults to current track)
- **<by_index>** Searches for track to loop by its index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /loop
- /loop **track_name:1** **by_index:True**
`Notes`
- If the current loop state is active and **<track_name>** is passed, instead of disabling the state, the track to loop will be **swapped**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and an active track.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **7** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
random:
Help for command: **random**
`Quick usage`
/random
`Description`
Submits a request to **randomize** track selection at every playback. Functions as a **toggle**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and a queue with atleast **1** track in it.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **7** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
queueloop:
Help for command: **queueloop**
`Quick usage`
/queueloop **<include_current_track>**
`Description`
Submits a request to **loop the queue**. Queue is **restored** after the last track **finishes playing**. Functions as a **toggle**.
`Parameters`
- **<include_current_track>** whether or not to include the currently playing track (if any) in the copied queue. (default True)
`Notes`
- Parameters have no effect when disabling queue loop.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, no **active queue modifications** and a queue with atleast **1** track in it.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **7** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
clear:
Help for command: **clear**
`Quick usage`
/clear **<clear_history>** **<clear_loop_queue>**
`Description`
Clears the queue, **removing** every track. Additionally, also clears the **history** and the **loop queue** (if /queueloop is active) if requested.
`Parameters`
- **<clear_history>** Clears track history if set to True (default False).
- **<clear_loop_queue>** Clears the copied queue produced by /queueloop if True. (default False)
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and a queue/track history with atleast **1** track.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
remove:
Help for command: **remove**
`Quick usage`
/remove **<track_names>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Removes **first occurrence** of track **matching** each name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) in the **<track_names>** list from the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<track_names>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of track names (or indices, if **<by_index>** is True).
- **<by_index>** Removes tracks by their index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /remove **track_names:The End C418; click C418**
- /remove **track_names:6; 2** **by_index:True**
`Notes`
- To remove tracks that have a semicolon in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, a queue with atleast **1** track in it and no **active extractions**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
reposition:
Help for command: **reposition**
`Quick usage`
/reposition **<track_name>** **<new_index>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Repositions **first occurrence** of track **matching** the given name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) to a new index in the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<track_name>** is the track name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) of the track to reposition.
- **<new_index>** is the new index for the track.
- **<by_index>** Repositions track by its index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /reposition **track_name:Strad C418** **new_index:3**
- /reposition **track_name:4** **new_index:3** **by_index:True**.
`Notes`
- To reposition tracks that have a semicolon in them, **prefix** the semicolon with '\\'.
- Does not affect the copied queue if /queueloop is enabled.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, queue with atleast **2** tracks, **<new_index>** must not be the same as the current one and no **active queue modifications**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
shuffle:
Help for command: **shuffle**
`Quick usage`
/shuffle
`Description`
Shuffles the queue in **random** order.
`Notes`
- Does not affect copied queue if /queueloop is enabled.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, queue with atleast **2** tracks and no **active queue modifications**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
seek:
Help for command: **seek**
`Quick usage`
/seek **<position>**
`Description`
Sets the track position to a given position formatted to **HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:30**).
`Parameters`
- **<position>** is the position to seek to. Must be formatted to **HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:30**)
`Examples`
- /seek **position:00:05:00**
- /seek **position:5:00**
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, **<position>** must be > **0** and < **track duration** and an **active or paused track playback**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
rewind:
Help for command: **rewind**
`Quick usage`
/rewind **<time>**
`Description`
Rewinds the track by a given time formatted to **HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:40**).
`Parameters`
- **<time>** is the time to rewind the track by. Must be formatted to **HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:40**)
`Examples`
- /rewind **time:00:00:10**
- /rewind **time:10**
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, **<time>** must be > **0** and < **track duration** and an **active or paused track playback**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
forward:
Help for command: **forward**
`Quick usage`
/forward **<time>**
`Description`
Forwards the track by a given time formatted to **HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:50**).
`Parameters`
- **<time>** is the time to forward the track by. Must be formatted to **HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:50**)
`Examples`
- /forward **time:00:00:30**
- /forward **time:30**
`Requirements`
Music role if set up, user and bot in voice channel, **<time>** must be > **0** and < **track duration** and an **active or paused track playback**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
queue:
Help for command: **queue**
`Quick usage`
/queue **<page>**
`Description`
Shows the first **25** tracks of a **queue page**.
`Parameters`
- **<page>** is the page to display. Must be > **0**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, queue with atleast **1** track and no **active queue modifications**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
history:
Help for command: **history**
`Quick usage`
/history **<page>**
`Description`
Shows the first **25** tracks of a **track history page**.
`Parameters`
- **<page>** is the page to display. Must be > **0**.
`Notes`
- Only up to **200** (default) tracks can be logged. Once this limit is reached, the bot will start **replacing** entries from the **end of the track history** with new ones.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, track history with atleast **1** track.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
extraction-progress:
Help for command: **extraction-progress**
`Quick usage`
/extraction-progress
`Description`
Shows info about the **current** extraction process.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and **an active extraction process**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
stop-extraction:
Help for command: **stop-extraction**
`Quick usage`
/stop-extraction
`Description`
Submits a request to stop the **current extraction process**.
`Notes`
- Request may not be registered instantly. Any **in-progress** track extraction will need to be completed before cancelling the whole process.
- Cancelling a playlist extraction may not work as playlists are considered one query, so the bot must complete extraction of the entire playlist before cancelling.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and **an active extraction process**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **7** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
epoch:
Help for command: **epoch**
`Quick usage`
/epoch
`Description`
Shows the **elapsed time** that has passed since the **first** track.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and having played atleast **one track since join time**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
yoink:
Help for command: **yoink**
`Quick usage`
/yoink
`Description`
Sends a DM containing information about the current track to the user **who invoked the command**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, **an active track and user must accept DMs from the bot**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **7** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
filter:
Help for command: **filter**
`Quick usage`
/filter **<min_duration>** **<max_duration>** **<author>** **<website>**
`Description`
Applies filters for track playback. The bot will choose tracks that **meet given requirements**. If **no tracks meet the given requirements**, it will select the **next track in the queue** at index 1.
`Parameters`
- **<min_duration>** The minimum duration range to match.
- **<max_duration>** The maximum duration range to match.
- **<author>** The author to match. Case-sensitive!
- **<website>** The media website to match.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, **<min_duration>** and **<max_duration>** must be formatted to **HH:MM:SS** and no **active queue modifications**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
clear-filters:
Help for command: **clear-filters**
`Quick usage`
/clear-filters **<min_duration>** **<max_duration>** **<author>** **<website>**
`Description`
Clears the given filters.
`Parameters`
- **<min_duration>** Whether or not to clear the minimum duration filter. (default False)
- **<max_duration>** Whether or not to clear the maximum duration filter. (default False)
- **<author>** Whether or not to clear the author filter. (default False)
- **<website>** Whether or not to clear the website filter. (default False)
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and given filters must be active.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
view-filters:
Help for command: **view-filters**
`Quick usage`
/view-filters
`Description`
Shows the **currently active filters**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
nowplaying:
Help for command: **nowplaying**
`Quick usage`
/nowplaying
`Description`
Shows information such as **title**, **author**, **duration**, **elapsed time** since the start and more about the current track in an embed.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and an active track playback.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
allow-greetings:
Help for command: **allow-greetings**
`Quick usage`
/allow-greetings **<enable>**
`Description`
Allows the bot to greet new users that join the current (if active) voice channel by sending a message. Defaults to True.
`Parameters`
- **<enable>** the value of the flag.
`Requirements`
Music role if set and user and bot in voice channel.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **7** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
allow-voice-status-edit:
Help for command: **allow-voice-status-edit**
`Quick usage`
/allow-voice-status-edit **<enable>**
`Description`
Allows the bot to edit voice channel status every time a new track is played. Defaults to True.
`Parameters`
- **<enable>** the value of the flag.
`Requirements`
Music role if set and user and bot in voice channel.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **7** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-view:
Help for command: **playlist-view**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-view **<playlist_name>** **<page>**
`Description`
Shows the first **25** tracks of a **playlist page**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the name of the playlist to view.
- **<page>** is the page to display. Must be > **0**.
`Examples`
- /playlist-view **playlist_name:GeometryDash** **page:1**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist must exist and not be empty** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-save-queue:
Help for command: **playlist-save-queue**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-save-queue **<playlist_name>**
`Description`
Creates or updates a playlist with the **current queue**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the name of the playlist to create or update.
- **<add_current_track>** whether or not to include the current track. (default True)
`Examples`
- /playlist-save-queue **playlist_name:StardewValley**.
`Requirements`
Music and playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no **active queue modifications**, queue must have <= **100** (default) elements, **<playlist_name>** must be <= **50** (default) characters and playlist count must be < **10** (default) if creating one, and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-save-history:
Help for command: **playlist-save-history**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-save-history **<playlist_name>**
`Description`
Creates or updates a playlist with the **current track history**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the name of the playlist to create or update.
`Requirements`
Music and playlist role if set, user and bot in voice channel, a track history with **atleast one track**, no **locked voice state** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a- **<playlist_name>** is the name of the playlist to create or update. cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-save-current-track:
Help for command: **playlist-save-current-track**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-save-current-track **<playlist_name>** **<index>**
`Description`
**Appends** the current track to the given playlist or **places** it at the given index, creating one if necessary.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify's name.
- **<index>** is the new track's index.
`Examples`
- /playlist-save-current-track **playlist_name:Random**
- /playlist-save-current-track **playlist_name:Random** **index:3**
`Requirements`
User and bot in voice channel, Music and Playlist role (if set), index must be > **0** and <= **maximum index of the playlist**, playlist must have less than **100** (default) items, **<playlist_name>** must be <= **50** (default) characters and **playlist** count must be < **10** (default) if creating one and an active track playback.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-select:
Help for command: **playlist-select**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-select **<playlist_name>** **<range_start>** **<range_end>** **<random_order>** **<clear_current_queue>**
`Description`
Adds all playlist tracks from range **<range_start>** to range **<range_end>** to the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to select.
- **<range_start>** indicates the start index of track selection (default is start of the playlist).
- **<range_end>** indicates at what index track selection should stop (default is the end of the playlist)
- **<random_order>** Whether or not the tracks in the given range should be selected randomly. (default False)
- **<clear_current_queue>** indicates whether or not the current queue should be cleared of all tracks in it. (default True).
`Examples`
- /playlist-select **playlist_name:StardewValley** **range_start:5**
- /playlist-select **playlist_name:Random** **clear_current_queue:False**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **<range_end>** must be >= **<range_start>**, no **active extractions or queue modifications**, **playlist must exist and have >= 1 track in it** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-create:
Help for command: **playlist-create**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-create **<playlist_name>**
`Description`
Creates a **blank** playlist with the specified name.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the new playlist's name.
`Examples`
- /playlist-create **playlist_name:Minecraft**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist must not exist already**, **<playlist_name>** must be <= **50** (default) characters, **playlist count must be < 10** (default) and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-delete:
Help for command: **playlist-delete**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-delete **<playlist_name>** **<erase_contents_only>**
`Description`
Deletes the specified playlist.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to delete's name.
- **<erase_contents_only>** Deletes only the contents of the playlist. (default False)
`Examples`
- /playlist-delete **playlist_name:Useless Playlist**
- /playlist-delete **playlist_name:Random** **erase_contents_only:True**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist must exist** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-remove:
Help for command: **playlist-remove**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-remove **<playlist_name>** **<track_names>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Removes **first occurrence** of track **matching** each name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) in **<track_names>** list from a playlist.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to remove tracks from's name.
- **<track_names>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of track names (or indices, if **<by_index>** is True) to bulk remove.
- **<by_index>** Removes tracks by their index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /playlist-remove **playlist_name:Minecraft** **track_names:bad apple**
- /playlist-remove **playlist_name:Minecraft** **track_names: 1; 3** **by_index:True**
`Notes`
- To remove tracks that have semicolons in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist and tracks must exist** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-reset:
Help for command: **playlist-reset**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-reset
`Description`
Deletes **all** saved playlists for the current guild. This is a **_dangerous_** and **destructive** command. Action is not undoable.
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in voice channel.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **60** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-rename:
Help for command: **playlist-rename**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-rename **<playlist_name>** **<new_playlist_name>**
`Description`
**Renames** a playlist to the specified **new name**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the original name of the playlist to rename.
- **<new_playlist_name>** is the new playlist's name.
`Examples`
- /playlist-rename **playlist_name:Minecraft** **new_playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, playlist must exist, **<new_playlist_name>** must be <= **50** (default) characters and different than **<playlist_name>** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-replace:
Help for command: **playlist-replace**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-replace **<playlist_name>** **<old>** **<new>** **<search_provider>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Replaces **first occurrence** of track matching given name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) with a new one fetched from **YouTube**, **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** or **Bandcamp**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify's name.
- **<old>** is the track to replace's name (or index, if **<by_index>** is True).
- **<new>** can be a **YouTube** (video **only**), **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** (song **only**), **Bandcamp** (song **only**) URL _or_ a **YouTube**/**SoundCloud search query** based on **<search_provider>**. Refer to **url-formats** help entry for URL formats.
- **<search_provider>** [**EXPERIMENTAL**] The provider to use for search query. URLs ignore this. (defaults to **YouTube search**)
- **<by_index>** Replaces track by its index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /playlist-replace **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **old:Sweden** **new:C418 Ki**
- /playlist-replace **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **old: 3** **new: C418 Ki** **by_index:True**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no **active extractions**, **playlist and old track must exist** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-reposition:
Help for command: **playlist-reposition**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-reposition **<playlist_name>** **<track_name>** **<index>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Repositions **first occurrence** of track **matching** given name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) to a **new index** in the playlist.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify's name.
- **<track_name>** is the track to reposition's name (or index, if **<by_index>** is True)
- **<index>** is the **new index** of the track.
- **<by_index>** Repositions track by its index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /playlist-reposition **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **track_name:Dreiton** **index:1**
- /playlist-reposition **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **track_name:4** **index:1** **by_index:True**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist and track must exist**, index must not be the **same as the current one** and must be > **0** and <= **maximum index of the playlist**, and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-add:
Help for command: **playlist-add**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-add **<playlist_name>** **<queries>** **<search_provider>**
`Description`
Adds **specified queries** fetched from **YouTube**, **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** or **Bandcamp** to a playlist, creating one if necessary.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to create or modify's name.
- **<queries>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of **YouTube** (video **only**), **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** (song **only**) or **Bandcamp** (song **only**) URLs _or_ **YouTube**/**SoundCloud search queries** depending on **<search_provider>** (Can be mixed). Refer to **url-formats** help entry for URL formats.
- **<search_provider>** [**EXPERIMENTAL**] The provider to use for search queries. URLs ignore this. (defaults to **YouTube search**)
`Notes`
- To search for queries that have a semicolon in them, **prefix** the semicolon first with '\\'.
`Examples`
- /playlist-add **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Alpha** **queries:C418 Sweden; C418 Living Mice; C418 Minecraft**
- /playlist-add **playlist_name:Random** **queries:I don't care about Christmas though feat. Nanahira** **search_provider:SoundCloud search**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no **active extractions**, **playlist must have < 100 (default) tracks**, **<playlist_name>** must be <= **50** (default) characters and **playlist count must be < 10 (default)** if creating one and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **25** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-copy:
Help for command: **playlist-copy**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-copy **<playlist_name>** **<target_playlist_name>**
`Description`
Copies a playlist's contents to a **new**/**existing** one.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** the playlist to copy's name.
- **<target_playlist_name>** the **target** playlist's name where the playlist will be copied.
`Examples`
- /playlist-copy **playlist_name:Stardew Valley target_playlist_name:Game music**
`Requirements`
Music and playlist role if set, **source playlist must exist and have atleast 1 track**, **source and target playlist names must not match**, **<target_playlist_name> must be <= 50 (default) characters** and **playlist count must be < 10** if creating one, **target playlist must have less than 100 (default) tracks** if it exists and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-copy-tracks:
Help for command: **playlist-copy-tracks**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-copy-tracks **<playlist_name>** **<target_playlist_name>** **<track_names>**
`Description`
Copies specified tracks from an existing playlist to a **new**/**existing** one.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** The playlist to copy tracks from's name.
- **<target_playlist_name>** The playlist to copy tracks to's name.
- **<track_names>** A semicolon (;) separated list of track names (or indices, if **<by_index>** is true) to copy to the **target playlist**.
- **<by_index>** Copies tracks by index.
`Notes`
- To copy tracks that have a semicolon in them, **prefix** the semicolon first with '\\'.
`Examples`
- /playlist-copy-tracks **playlist_name:StardewValley target_playlist_name:GameMusic track_names:1;2;6 by_index:True**
`Requirements`
Music and playlist role if set, user and bot in voice channel, **source playlist and specified tracks must exist**, **source playlist and target playlist names must not match**, **<target_playlist_name> must be <= 50 (default) characters** and **playlist count must be < 10** if creating one, **target playlist must have less than 100 (default) tracks** if it exists.
`Cooldown`
Has a **10** second cooldown **per-guild**.
playlist-fetch-tracks:
Help for command: **playlist-fetch-tracks**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-fetch-tracks **<playlist_name>** **<track_names>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Adds **specified playlist tracks** (either by name, or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) to the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to select tracks from's name.
- **<track_names>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of track names (or indices, if **<by_index>** is True) from the playlist.
- **<by_index>** Fetches tracks by their index. (default False)
`Notes`
- Only up to **25** (default) queries can be sent per command
- To search for tracks that have semicolons in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
`Examples`
- /playlist-fetch-tracks **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **track_names:Dreiton; Taswell**
- /playlist-fetch-tracks **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **track_names: 4; 5** **by_index:True**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no **active extractions or queue modifications**, **playlist and tracks must exist** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **25** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-fetch-random-tracks:
Help for command: **playlist-fetch-random-tracks**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-fetch-random-tracks **<playlist_name>** **<amount>**
`Description`
Adds random tracks to the queue based on the given amount.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to select tracks from's name.
- **<amount>** is the amount of random tracks to select. Must be <= **25**.
`Examples`
- /playlist-fetch-random-tracks **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Alpha** **amount:5**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no **active extractions or queue modifications**, **playlist must exist and not be empty** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **25** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-import:
Help for command: **playlist-import**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-import **<playlist_name>** **<query>**
`Description`
**Creates** or **adds** tracks to a playlist from a specified playlist URL.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify or create's name.
- **<query>** must be a **YouTube**/**SoundCloud**/**Bandcamp** playlist URL. Refer to **url-formats** help entry for URL formats.
`Examples`
- /playlist-import **playlist_name:Cookie Clicker** **query:https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=OLAK5uy_keWBIVtHjna-VvhL5_XCB0BaNx-2Y0PK8**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no **active extractions**, **playlist must have < 100 (default) tracks**, **<playlist_name> must be <= 50 (default) characters** and **total playlist count must be < 10 (default)** if creating one and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-rename-tracks:
Help for command: **playlist-rename-tracks**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-rename-tracks **<playlist_name>** **<old_track_names>** **<new_track_names>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Replaces the **original** title of a track (or a **sequence of tracks**) with a **new** one (or a **sequence of new names**).
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify's name.
- **<old_track_names>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of track names (or indices, if **<by_index>** is True).
- **<new_track_names>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of new names to assign to the old tracks.
- **<by_index>** Renames tracks by their index. (default False)
`Notes`
- To edit tracks that have semicolons in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
`Examples`
- /playlist-rename-tracks **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **old_track_names: C418 Ki; C418 Ward** **new_track_names: Ki; Ward**
- /playlist-rename-tracks **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **old_track_names: 2; 4** **new_track_names: Ki; Ward**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist and tracks must exist**, **new names must be <= 50 (default) characters long and not be the same as the old ones** and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-get-saved:
Help for command: **playlist-get-saved**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-get-saved
`Description`
Shows the saved playlists for the **current** guild.
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), guild must have atleast **one** playlist and no **locked playlists**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
role-set:
Help for command: **role-set**
`Quick usage`
/role-set **<role>** **<playlist>** **<overwrite>** **<show>**
`Description`
**Sets** the default music/playlist role that users **must have** in order to execute music/playlist commands.
`Parameters`
- **<role>** is the role name and must exist in the guild.
- **<playlist>** indicates whether or not the set role should be the playlist role.
- **<overwrite>** Whether or not the current role (if it exists) should be **overwritten** with the **new one**. (default False)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /role-set **role:DJ** **playlist:False**
- /role-set **role:DJ+** **playlist:True**
`Requirements`
Administrator or Owner permissions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **15** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
role-get:
Help for command: **role-get**
`Quick usage`
/role-get **<playlist>** **<show>**
`Description`
**Shows** the default music/playlist role set for the **current guild**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist>** indicates whether or not the command should read the playlist role.
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Requirements`
Administrator or Owner permissions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **5** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
role-remove:
Help for command: **role-remove**
`Quick usage`
/role-remove **<role>** **<playlist>** **<show>**
`Description`
**Removes** the default music/playlist role set for the **current guild**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist>** indicates whether or not the command should remove the playlist role.
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Requirements`
Administrator or Owner permissions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **15** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
role-reset:
Help for command: **role-reset**
`Quick usage`
/role-reset **<show>**
`Description`
Rewrites the saved role structure in need to bulk delete all roles.
`Parameters`
- **<show>** whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Requirements`
Owner or Administrator permissions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **60** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
purge:
Help for command: **purge**
`Quick usage`
/purge **<channel>** **<amount>** **<user>** **<word>** **<show>**
`Description`
Bulk removes specified amount of messages from a specified channel.
`Parameters`
- **<channel>** is the channel to purge. (defaults to current channel).
- **<amount>** is the maximum amount of messages to delete, must be <= **500** (default **100**).
- **<user>** If filled, only deletes messages sent by user **<user>**. (default None)
- **<word>** If filled, only deletes messages that have the word **<word>** in them. (default None)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Notes`
- Due to performance concerns, only messages that are not older than **14** days are deleted.
`Examples`
- /purge **amount:50** **channel:#general-english** **show:True**
- /purge **user:@john**
`Requirements`
Manage messages permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **45** (default) seconds **per-user**.
kick:
Help for command: **kick**
`Quick usage`
/kick **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Kicks specified member from the guild.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to kick. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the kick reason. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /kick **member: @peter** **reason:spam** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Kick members permission (both user and bot), user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
ban:
Help for command: **ban**
`Quick usage`
/ban **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Bans specified member from the guild.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to ban. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the ban reason. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel (default False).
`Examples`
- /ban **member: @peter** **reason:violated server rules multiple times.** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Ban members permission (both user and bot), user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
unban:
Help for command: **unban**
`Quick usage`
/unban **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Unbans specified member, allowing them to join the guild again.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** can be the username, global name or ID of the member to unban.
- **<reason>** is the unban reason. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Notes`
- Due to performance concerns, ban entries retreival is limited to **1000** members.
`Examples`
- /unban **member:peter** **reason:apologized** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Ban member permission (both user and bot) and target member must be in unban entries.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
timeout:
Help for command: **timeout**
`Quick usage`
/timeout **<duration>** **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Times out specified member. Forbidding them from sending messages or joining voice channels.
`Parameters`
- **<duration>** is the timeout duration. Must be a time value formatted to **DD:HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:00:00**), day cannot be higher than **28**.
- **<member>** is the member to timeout. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the timeout reason. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /timeout **duration: 00:05:00:00** **member:@lana** **reason: annoying people in general** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Manage members permission (both user and bot), target member must not be timed out already, user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
remove-timeout:
Help for command: **remove-timeout**
`Quick usage`
/remove-timeout **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Removes timeout from specified member.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to remove timeout from. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for removing the timeout. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /remove-timeout **member:@lana** **reason:apologized** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Manage members permission (both user and bot) and target member must be timed out.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
add-role:
Help for command: **add-role**
`Quick usage`
/add-role **<role>** **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Adds specified role to specified member.
`Parameters`
- **<role>** is the role to add. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<member>** is the member to add the role to, can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for adding the role. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /add-role **role:@DJ** **member:@peter**
`Requirements`
Manage roles permission (both user and bot), target member must not already have specified role and user and bot's top role must be higher than specified role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
remove-role:
Help for command: **remove-role**
`Quick usage`
/remove-role **<role>** **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Removes specified role from specified member.
`Parameters`
- **<role>** is the role to remove. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<member>** is the member to remove the role from. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for removing role from member. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /remove-role **role:@DJ** **member:@peter**
`Requirements`
Manage roles permission (both user and bot), target member must have specified role, user and bot's top role must be higher than specified role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
remove-channel:
Help for command: **remove-channel**
`Quick usage`
/remove-channel **<channel>** **<show>**
`Description`
Removes the specified channel from the guild.
`Parameters`
- **<channel>** is the channel to delete. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /remove-channel **channel:#useless-channel** **show:False**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
make-text-channel:
Help for command: **make-text-channel**
`Quick usage`
/make-text-channel **<name>** **<topic>** **<category>** **<announcement>** **<slowmode_delay>** **<nsfw>** **<position>** **<show>**
`Description`
Creates a text channel with the given parameters.
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the name of the new channel. Must be <= **100** characters.
- **<topic>** is the channel topic. Appears at the top of the text channel chat box. Must be <= **1024** characters (defaults to none)
- **<category>** is the category to apply the channel to. Leave empty for none.
- **<announcement>** Whether or not the channel is an announcement channel. **Requires a community-enabled guild.** (default False)
- **<slowmode_delay>** is the slowmode delay to apply to the channel, must be in seconds. Maximum is **21600**. (defaults to 0)
- **<nsfw>** can be true or false, marks the channel as NSFW if true. (default False)
- **<position>** is the position of the new channels relative to all channels, the lower the number, the higher the channel is on the channel list, the higher, the lower the channel is on the channel list. Must be >= **1**. (defaults to 1)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-text-channel **name:coolchannel** **category:#coolchannels** **show:False**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-user**.
make-voice-channel:
Help for command: **make-voice-channel**
`Quick usage`
/make-voice-channel **<name>** **<category>** **<position>** **<bitrate>** **<user_limit>** **<video_quality_mode>** **<show>**
`Description`
Creates a voice channel with the given parameters.
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the name of the new channel. Must be <= **100** characters.
- **<category>** is the category to apply the new channel to. Leave empty for none.
- **<position>** is the position of the new channel relative to the all channels. The lower, the higher the channel will be, the higher, the lower the channel will be. Must be >= **1**. (defaults to 1)
- **<bitrate>** is the new channel's bitrate, must be >= **8000** and <= **guild's maximum bitrate**. (defaults to 64000)
- **<user_limit>** is the maximum amount of users that can join the channel. Must be <= **99**. (defaults to 0 (infinite))
- **<video_quality_mode>** is the video quality mode, if unsure, leave the default (auto).
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-voice-channel **name:coolchannel** **category:#coolchannels** **user_limit:20**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-user**.
make-category:
Help for command: **make-category**
`Quick usage`
/make-category **<name>** **<position>** **<show>**
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the new category's name. Must be <= **100** characters.
- **<position>** is the new category's position relative to all categories. The lower the number, the higher the category will be, the higher, the lower the category will be. Must be >= **1**. (defaults to 1)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-category **name:coolerchannels** **position:0** **show:False**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-user**.
make-forum:
Help for command: **make-forum**
`Quick usage`
/make-forum **<name>** **<post_guidelines>** **<position>** **<category>** **<slowmode_delay>** **<nsfw>** **<show>**
`Description`
Creates a forum channel with the given parameters.
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the new forum's name. Must be <= **100** characters.
- **<post_guidelines>** is the new forum's posting guidelines that appear when a member makes a new post. Must be <= **4096** characters. (defaults to none)
- **<position>** is the position of the new forum relative to all channels. The lower the number, the higher the channel is, the higher, the lower the channel will be. Must be >= **1**. (defaults to 1).
- **<category>** is the category to apply the forum to. Leave empty for none.
- **<slowmode_delay>** is the slowmode delay to apply for this forum in seconds. Maximum is **21600**. (defaults to 0)
- **<nsfw>** can be true or false, indicates whether or not the forum is NSFW. (default False)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-forum **name:anime** **category:#Media** **slowmode_delay:60**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot) and a **community-enabled guild**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-user**.
make-stage:
Help for command: **make-stage**
`Quick usage`
/make-stage **<name>** **<category>** **<position>** **<bitrate>** **<video_quality_mode>** **<show>**
`Description`
Creates a stage channel with the given parameters
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the new stage channel's name. Must be <= **100** characters.
- **<category>** is the category to apply the new stage channel to. Leave empty for none.
- **<position>** is the position of the new stage channel relative to all channels. The lower the number, the higher the channel is, the higher, the lower the channel is. Must be >= **1** (defaults to 1).
- **<bitrate>** is the new stage channel's bitrate. Must be >= **8000** and <= **64000** (defaults to 64000)
- **<video_quality_mode>** is the new channel's video quality mode, if unsure, leave the default (auto).
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-stage **name:coolstage** **category:#coolchannels**
`Requirements`
Manage channels (both user and bot) and a **community-enabled guild**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-user**.
slowmode:
Help for command: **slowmode**
`Quick usage`
/slowmode **<slowmode_delay>** **<channel>** **<show>**
`Description`
Changes the slowmode delay of the current/specified channel.
`Parameters`
- **<slowmode_delay>** is the slowmode delay in seconds. Maximum is **21600**. (defaults to 0)
- **<channel>** is the channel to apply the new slowmode delay value to. Leave empty for current one.
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /slowmode **slowmode_delay:5**
- /slowmode **slowmode_delay:300** **channel:#media**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **15** (default) seconds **per-user**.
announce:
Help for command: **announce**
`Quick usage`
/announce **<message>** **<channel>** **<no_markdown>** **<no_mentions>**
`Description`
Announce a message in a specified text channel.
`Parameters`
- **<message>** is the message to announce, must be <= **2000** characters. Supports mentions and markdown.
- **<channel>** is the channel to announce the message in. Leave empty for current channel.
- **<no_markdown>** Whether or not to ignore markdown text formatting (Ex. **hi** --> hi). (default False)
- **<no_mentions>** Whether or not to ignore formatting of mentions. (default False)
`Examples`
- /announce **message: Hi @everyone!**
- /announce **message:@peter has been demoted for breaking staff rules.** **channel:#moderator-only**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (user), Send messages (bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **15** (default) seconds **per-user**.
vckick:
Help for command: **vckick**
`Quick usage`
/vckick **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Kicks specified member from their current voice channel.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to kick. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for kicking the user from its voice channel. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
/vckick **member:@john** **reason:being disruptive** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Move members permission (both user and bot), target member must be in a voice channel, user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
vcmove:
Help for command: **vcmove**
`Quick usage`
/vcmove **<member>** **<target_voice_channel>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Moves specified member from its current voice channel to target voice channel.
- **<member>** is the member to move. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<target_voice_channel>** is the target voice channel to move member to. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for moving member to channel target voice channel. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
/vcmove **member:@alex** **target_voice_channel:#afk** **reason:afk** **show:False**
`Requirements`
Move members permission (both user and bot), target member must be in a voice channel, user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role, bot must have permission to connect to both the source (target member's channel) and target channel.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
vcmute:
Help for command: **vcmute**
`Quick usage`
/vcmute **<member>** **<mute>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Mutes or unmutes specified member in voice channel.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to mute. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<mute>** can be true or false, a value of false will unmute. (default True)
- **<reason>** is the reason for mute/unmute. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
/vcmute **member:@lana** **mute:True** **reason:being annoying** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Mute members permission (both user and bot), target member must be in voice channel, user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-user**.
